commit_message:
Enable evacuation with qos ports

Previous patch [1] implemented support for evacuation of servers with
neutron ports having resource request. So this patch removes the API
check that rejected such operations and document the new feature.

[1] Id9ed7a82d42be8ffe760f03e6610b9e6f5a4287b

Change-Id: Id5f2f4f22b856c989e2eef8ed56b9829d1bcefb6
blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports-ussuri
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/88/688688/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Evacuation is now supported for servers with neutron ports having resource requests. E.g. ports that have QoS minimum bandwidth rules attached.

commit_message:
Adding check for IPv6 address in setup_controllers

If it is IPv6 then adding [] to it before
creating the connection string.

Change-Id: Idd108cbef944cdd89808bb1ad5c8ab1db202d31a
Closes-Bug: #1846494

commit_message:
Add KeyValueAppendAction to osc-lib

This is required to support things like the '--hint' option for
'openstack server create', which allows you to specify arguments
multiple times.

Change-Id: If73cab759fa09bddf1ff519923c5972c3b2052b1
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/osc-lib refs/changes/59/685359/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Ensures that ``dest`` is a dict and values are strings.class KeyValueAppendAction(argparse.Action): """A custom action to parse arguments as key=value pairs Ensures that ``dest`` is a dict and values are lists of strings. """ def __call__(self, parser, namespace, values, option_string=None): # Make sure we have an empty dict rather than None if getattr(namespace, self.dest, None) is None: setattr(namespace, self.dest, {}) # Add value if an assignment else remove it if '=' in values: key, value = values.split('=', 1) # NOTE(qtang): Prevent null key setting in property if '' == key: msg = _("Property key must be specified: %s") raise argparse.ArgumentTypeError(msg % str(values)) dest = getattr(namespace, self.dest) if key in dest: dest[key].append(value) else: dest[key] = [value] else: msg = _("Expected 'key=value' type, but got: %s") raise argparse.ArgumentTypeError(msg % str(values))

commit_message:
Use autoprogram-cliff for remaining plugin docs

Sphinx errors have been fixed in the plugin projects for octavia, rsd,
trove, watcher, and zun, so we can now use autoprogram-cliff to generate
the docs for those.

Change-Id: Ia7790c5e86957afd0aec8f9a04ffc7aa968b4eeb
Story: #1735016
Task: #37241

commit_message:
Use SDK to get compute API extensions

python-novaclient 16.0.0 removed the deprecated
list_extensions module [1] so this changes the
extensions command to use openstacksdk to get the
compute API extensions.

The functional test ExtensionTests.test_extension_list_compute
ensures this works.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/686516/

Change-Id: I9894bc395c0474aaa6494ac4534862efe4ea7984
Story: #2006769
Task: #37284

List l7poclies by listener

Sample CLI:
openstack loadbalancer l7policy list --listener <Name or ID>

Story: 2006617
Task: 36820

Change-Id: Ie02b5a4bbec7243806a0a9523897dd82e6737482
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-octaviaclient refs/changes/24/684924/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch('octaviaclient.osc.v2.utils.get_l7policy_attrs') def test_l7policy_list_by_listener(self, mock_l7policy_attrs): mock_l7policy_attrs.return_value = { 'listener_id': self._l7po.listener_id, } arglist = ['--listener', 'mock_li_id'] verifylist = [('listener', 'mock_li_id')] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) columns, data = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) self.api_mock.l7policy_list.assert_called_with( listener_id=self._l7po.listener_id ) self.assertEqual(self.columns, columns) self.assertEqual(self.datalist, tuple(data))

commit_message:
Complete overcloud deploy --baremetal-deployment

The overcloud deploy --baremetal-deployment argument is an alternative
to calling the provision and unprovision commands separately, giving
users the option of only needing to call overcloud deploy to also
manage baremetal.

This change does the following:
- adds the missing plan argument to deploy_roles to support
  multi-overcloud
- calls undeploy_roles after the heat stack operation, to unprovision
  any nodes that are flagged as provisioned:false

Blueprint: nova-less-deploy
Change-Id: Ia4d064d7b039ef3afcee38de8ad1aa47f035a263

commit_message:
Add "radvd_user" config parameter to Neutron L3 container

The username passed to radvd, used to drop root privileges and change
user ID to username and group ID to the primary group of username. If no
user specified, the user executing the L3 agent will be passed. If "root"
specified, because radvd is spawned as root, no "username" parameter
will be passed

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691846/
Change-Id: Ie9f16f3117e6531f4ef1e4973e61c72dbf904b8a
Closes-Bug: #1844688

If no user specified, the user executing the L3 agent will be passed. If "root" specified, because radvd is spawned as root, no "username" parameter will be passed type: string - neutron::agents::l3::radvd_user: {get_param: NeutronL3AgentRadvdUser}

commit_message:
Install and start Rsyslog on the Undercloud & Standalone

Create a new Rsyslog service that is deployed on the host (not in a
container) and with Ansible.

Make it so it's deployed by default on Undercloud & Standalone setups.
Also move the tasks that configure rsyslogd for HAproxy & Swift to be
executed after the host prep tasks (using deploy step tasks).

Change-Id: I027c64aefcc4715da17836a5cf0141152cf146aa
Closes-Bug: #1850562
(cherry picked from commit 5ff628f1cfb72a88e7414370e0f9083a206eb710)

commit_message:
Improvements to unprovision command

- print a table of baremetal nodes which are about to be unprovisioned
- prompt user to confirm unprovision, overridable with --yes argument
- add an -all argument which will unprovision all nodes in the yaml,
  instead of just the provisioned:false nodes.
- add the missing plan argument to the provision deploy_roles to
  support multiple overcloud stacks

Blueprint: nova-less-undercloud

Change-Id: I25c5311ec3599e0de9bd87038366ed8c7d7896a2

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: I6cc03c2ca734cd71fb4c36f98d5097994d3b8349
Sem-Ver: feature

subject: new subcommand for hypervisor: evacuate
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-02 13:01:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/4b36cedba0ca6f56f54cec8b8f81b429cb35412f', 'message': 'new subcommand for hypervisor: evacuate

Taken mostly from python-novaclient, we need an easy way to clear a hypervisor
before taking it offline, either for maintenance or decomissioning.

I imagine two types of uses for this command.

1. You're taking down a hypervisor for maintenance, and just want the scheduler
   to rebalance the servers to other hypervisors.
2. You're replacing a hypervisor, and would like to move all servers on this
   hypervisor to a replacement. (hence --target option)

I'm a little unsure about what are the appropriate actions for the various
states a server can be in. But since the API doesn't like live-migrating
instances that are not ACTIVE (including PAUSED or SUSPENDED) avoid trying
that.

Also, little unsure as to just "non-live" migrating ACTIVE servers, so not
doing that either unless --force is specified.

Change-Id: Ib61b394d7201e4b0fc9e01a31d370860c4920680
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-23 11:28:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/f43989053a6a83cea2c684d0a144c367135930be', 'message': 'new subcommand for hypervisor: evacuate

Taken mostly from python-novaclient, we need an easy way to clear a hypervisor
before taking it offline, either for maintenance or decomissioning.

I imagine two types of uses for this command.

1. You're taking down a hypervisor for maintenance, and just want the scheduler
   to rebalance the servers to other hypervisors.
2. You're replacing a hypervisor, and would like to move all servers on this
   hypervisor to a replacement. (hence --target option)

I'm a little unsure about what are the appropriate actions for the various
states a server can be in. But since the API doesn't like live-migrating
instances that are not ACTIVE (including PAUSED or SUSPENDED) avoid trying
that.

Also, little unsure as to just "non-live" migrating ACTIVE servers, so not
doing that either unless --force is specified.

Change-Id: Ib61b394d7201e4b0fc9e01a31d370860c4920680
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-08-23 11:38:38.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/compute/v2/hypervisor.py', 'openstackclient/tests/unit/compute/v2/test_hypervisor.py', 'doc/source/cli/command-objects/hypervisor.rst', 'setup.cfg'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/35dee8e8d379afb0ce66836d9226ac37d703d58c', 'message': 'new subcommand for hypervisor: evacuate

before taking it offline, either for maintenance or decomissioning.

I imagine two types of uses for this command.

1. You're taking down a hypervisor for maintenance, and just want the scheduler
   to rebalance the servers to other hypervisors.
2. You're replacing a hypervisor, and would like to move all servers on this
   hypervisor to a replacement. (hence --target option)

I'm a little unsure about what are the appropriate actions for the various
states a server can be in. But since the API doesn't like live-migrating
instances that are not ACTIVE (including PAUSED or SUSPENDED) avoid trying
that.

Also, little unsure as to just "non-live" migrating ACTIVE servers, so not
doing that either unless --force is specified.

Change-Id: Ib61b394d7201e4b0fc9e01a31d370860c4920680
'}]
commit_message:
new subcommand for hypervisor: evacuate

Taken mostly from python-novaclient, we need an easy way to clear a hypervisor
before taking it offline, either for maintenance or decomissioning.

I imagine two types of uses for this command.

1. You're taking down a hypervisor for maintenance, and just want the scheduler
   to rebalance the servers to other hypervisors.
2. You're replacing a hypervisor, and would like to move all servers on this
   hypervisor to a replacement. (hence --target option)

I'm a little unsure about what are the appropriate actions for the various
states a server can be in. But since the API doesn't like live-migrating
instances that are not ACTIVE (including PAUSED or SUSPENDED) avoid trying
that.

Also, little unsure as to just "non-live" migrating ACTIVE servers, so not
doing that either unless --force is specified.

Change-Id: Ib61b394d7201e4b0fc9e01a31d370860c4920680

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: cleanly ignore RTC route of unsupported type

When a BGP peer advertises an RTC route (RFC4684) with
a route target of a type bagpipe-bgp does not support, we
need to ignore these cleanly, and not break and reset the
BGP peering.

Note that it is safe to plainly ignore such routes because,
since bagpipe-bgp does not support them, it will never need
to propagate event for such RTs to a BGP peer.

Change-Id: Ie8d441b9d7669ec22236b2273d8e69a884751309

commit_message:
Stop prefetching images in server list

The server list call prefetches all images visible to the user. On a
cloud with hundreds of public images (or if you run 'server list' as
admin) this call can take over a minute to complete. Even if the project
in question only has a single instance.

This patch removes the prefetch, and only populates the dict of images
for image ids corresponding to the instance list.

In our environment this drops the time it takes for 'server list' to
return from 57+ seconds to 2.5 seconds.

Change-Id: I16cba79c90456a3a59359cae456e7f90d6f9fafa

commit_message:
Use 2.latest compute microversion as default

With this patch, the default os-compute-api-version will get lined
up with that in novaclient [1].
Note that this default value will not take effect until patch [2]
is merged.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/novaclient/shell.py#L47
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/600330/

Change-Id: I815f6edfbae333b22eb539e14e8777f8d9dad570

commit_message:
Revert "install LIBS_FROM_GIT using python 2 and 3 where appropriate"

All the OpenStack projects should be able to run under Python 3 now so
the fallback installation of the Python 2 libraries should not be
needed any longer. This also avoids the problem of script files
installed by the libraries sometimes being overwritten by the Python 2
version leading to incorrect execution later, as discussed in
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-September/009226.html

This reverts commit a2eb89417fbb6d61526b1819cbe3d0a60537eedd.

Change-Id: I1cdb7e4a209872f1620be556b7278879a4b86df5

commit_message:
Avoid error 500 on shelve task_state race

When shelving a server and saving its new SHELVING task state, we
expect the current task state to be None and do not handle any
UnexpectedTaskStateError exceptions that the database layer may throw
at us. In those cases, we return an error 500 to the user, when in
actuality an error 409 conflict would be more appropriate. This
patch makes the API layer handle UnexpectedTaskStateError exceptions
and return a 409 to the user.

NOTE(artom) Conflict in imports in
nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_shelve.py due to using
oslo's uuidsentinel as of 8e1ca5bf34f924b9a23ddbcf31ae727a7dcacb20 in
stein.

Closes-bug: 1850694
Change-Id: Ie0b421cd5d3a5781c1dd09fab4ed013ece0f939d
(cherry picked from commit a423d8b27785623550f401a200b68ca926c0a119)
(cherry picked from commit 32dbd2f585ef1902478170f3a1153b1f71e81db3)
(cherry picked from commit 8ee59604dcd9f770286f54e3a39c80f54413c358)

commit_message:
DNM never delete a nova server

When upgrading from heat/nova managed servers to nova-less, the nova
based nested stacks will be deleted and replaced with deployed-server
based stacks. With this change, the underlying ironic nodes will not
be undeployed by nova.

Change-Id: I22864eae812f2feb07dce4e3ffdfd7222507c614
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

commit_message:
Add package-replacements files

As an alternative to having if/else for python3 specific packages in the
docker files, this adds a --package-replacements file option to allow a
user to pass a basic dictionary of { 'current-packagename':
'new-packagename', ... } to have the packages replaced when built.  The
previous proposal was https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632156/

This would prevent having to do an append/remove from packages list when
there's an alternate package name.

Change-Id: I0a7630e07c5100199236170f745f2c8148df6c42

Unpin quickstart undercloud ara version

Change-Id: I4e33c7367b538140aeb06543a36f169f349c3f19

deleted_lines: - `undercloud_ara_version`: <'0.15.0'> -- Default version of ara to install

subject: Lookup pre/post deployment vars with hostvars
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-10-09 17:46:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/36a6da7272ea4eff4c6a9b8ca98bfe9d5734aa7d', 'message': 'Lookup pre/post deployment vars with hostvars

The lookup function that was used previously still failed when these
vars were not defined. Using hostvars instead allows these to be
defaulted to [] when the vars are not actually defined.

Change-Id: I51f3c21f07a893848483a14e399a6d402a6205b8
Resolves: rhbz#1760013
(cherry picked from commit 4f9b32a9f41ee1dcd8f9b1f9032c81d4bed25f5f)

commit_message:
Lookup pre/post deployment vars with hostvars

The lookup function that was used previously still failed when these
vars were not defined. Using hostvars instead allows these to be
defaulted to [] when the vars are not actually defined.

Change-Id: I51f3c21f07a893848483a14e399a6d402a6205b8
(cherry picked from commit 4f9b32a9f41ee1dcd8f9b1f9032c81d4bed25f5f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/38/687638/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: with_items: "{{ '{{' }} lookup('vars', 'pre_deployments_' + tripleo_role_name)|default([]) {{ '}}' }}" with_items: "{{ '{{' }} lookup('vars', 'post_deployments_' + tripleo_role_name)|default([]) {{ '}}' }}"

subject: Add FinishResizeAtDestTask
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-02-07 21:16:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f7238ad6444ba8f8a7e81aca4458523e7bb77d3e', 'message': 'WIP: Add FinishResizeAtDestTask

TODO: tests

This adds the FinishResizeAtDestTask sub-task which
asynchronously RPC calls finish_snapshot_based_resize_at_dest
on the destination compute service in the target cell
to finish the resize.

If that is successful, the "hidden" field on the source
and target cell instance record is swapped so that the API
shows the target cell instance and updates the instance
mapping record to point at the target cell since confirm/revert
actions at that point start in the target cell.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: I3e28c0163dc14dacf847c5a69730ba2e29650370
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-02-08 21:19:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/2df0582a08106ee9c72a888170a2d40673445486', 'message': 'Add FinishResizeAtDestTask

This adds the FinishResizeAtDestTask sub-task which
asynchronously RPC calls finish_snapshot_based_resize_at_dest
on the destination compute service in the target cell
to finish the resize.

If that is successful, the "hidden" field on the source
and target cell instance record is swapped so that the API
shows the target cell instance and updates the instance
mapping record to point at the target cell since confirm/revert
actions at that point start in the target cell.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

commit_message:
Add FinishResizeAtDestTask

This adds the FinishResizeAtDestTask sub-task which
synchronously RPC calls finish_snapshot_based_resize_at_dest
on the destination compute service in the target cell
to finish the resize.

If that is successful, the "hidden" field on the source
and target cell instance record is swapped so that the API
shows the target cell instance and updates the instance
mapping record to point at the target cell since confirm/revert
actions at that point start in the target cell.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: I3e28c0163dc14dacf847c5a69730ba2e29650370
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/46/635646/43 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_utils import excutilsfrom nova.compute import vm_statesclass FinishResizeAtDestTask(base.TaskBase): """Task to finish the resize at the destination host. Calls the finish_snapshot_based_resize_at_dest method on the destination compute service which sets up networking and block storage and spawns the guest on the destination host. Upon successful completion of this task, the migration status should be 'finished', the instance task_state should be None and the vm_state should be 'resized'. The instance host/node information should also reflect the destination compute. If the compute call is successful, the task will change the instance mapping to point at the target cell and hide the source cell instance thus making the confirm/revert operations act on the target cell instance. """ def __init__(self, context, instance, migration, source_cell_instance, compute_rpcapi, target_cell_mapping): """Initialize this task. :param context: nova auth request context targeted at the target cell :param instance: Instance object in the target cell database :param migration: Migration object in the target cell database :param source_cell_instance: Instance object in the source cell DB :param compute_rpcapi: instance of nova.compute.rpcapi.ComputeAPI :param target_cell_mapping: CellMapping object for the target cell """ super(FinishResizeAtDestTask, self).__init__(context, instance) self.migration = migration self.source_cell_instance = source_cell_instance self.compute_rpcapi = compute_rpcapi self.target_cell_mapping = target_cell_mapping def _finish_snapshot_based_resize_at_dest(self): """Synchronously RPC calls finish_snapshot_based_resize_at_dest If the finish_snapshot_based_resize_at_dest method fails in the compute service, this method will update the source cell instance data to reflect the error (vm_state='error', copy the fault and instance action events for that compute method). """ # prep_snapshot_based_resize_at_source in the source cell would have # changed the source cell instance.task_state to resize_migrated and # we need to reflect that in the target cell instance before calling # the destination compute. self.instance.task_state = task_states.RESIZE_MIGRATED self.instance.save() try: self.compute_rpcapi.finish_snapshot_based_resize_at_dest( self.context, self.instance, self.migration) except Exception: # What we need to do here is mimic the error handlers on # finish_snapshot_based_resize_at_dest in the destination compute # service so those changes are reflected in the source cell # instance. with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(logger=LOG): # reverts_task_state and _error_out_instance_on_exception: self.source_cell_instance.task_state = None self.source_cell_instance.vm_state = vm_states.ERROR self.source_cell_instance.save() source_cell_context = self.source_cell_instance._context # wrap_instance_fault (this is best effort) self._copy_latest_fault(source_cell_context) # wrap_instance_event (this is best effort) self._copy_finish_snapshot_based_resize_at_dest_events( source_cell_context) def _copy_latest_fault(self, source_cell_context): """Copies the latest instance fault from the target cell to the source :param source_cell_context: nova auth request context targeted at the source cell """ try: # Get the latest fault from the target cell database. fault = objects.InstanceFault.get_latest_for_instance( self.context, self.instance.uuid) if fault: # Could re-use _clone_creatable_object here. fault._context = source_cell_context delattr(fault, 'id') # make it creatable in the source cell DB fault.create() except Exception: LOG.exception( 'Failed to copy instance fault from target cell DB', instance=self.instance) def _copy_finish_snapshot_based_resize_at_dest_events( self, source_cell_context): """Copies the compute_finish_snapshot_based_resize_at_dest events from the target cell database to the source cell database. """ try: # TODO(mriedem): Need a method on InstanceActionEventList to # lookup an event by action request_id and event name. action = objects.InstanceAction.get_by_request_id( self.context, self.instance.uuid, self.context.request_id) if action: events = objects.InstanceActionEventList.get_by_action( self.context, action.id) # Find the events for finish_snapshot_based_resize_at_dest. event_name = 'compute_finish_snapshot_based_resize_at_dest' events_by_id = {} # InstanceActionEvent keyed by id for event in events: if event.event == event_name: events_by_id[event.id] = event LOG.debug('Found %s events with name %s', len(events_by_id), event_name, instance=self.instance) # Sort by id in ascending order so we create the events in # the source cell database in the same order they were created # in the target cell database. for event_id in sorted(events_by_id): event = events_by_id[event_id] # Could re-use _clone_creatable_object here. event._context = source_cell_context delattr(event, 'id') # make it creatable in the source DB event.create(action.instance_uuid, action.request_id) else: LOG.warning( 'Failed to find InstanceAction by request_id %s', self.context.request_id, instance=self.instance) except Exception: LOG.exception( 'Failed to copy finish_snapshot_based_resize_at_dest' ' instance action events from target cell DB', instance=self.instance) def _update_instance_mapping(self): """Swaps the hidden field value on the source and target cell instance and updates the instance mapping to point at the target cell. """ # Mark the target cell instance record as hidden=False so it will show # up when listing servers. Note that because of how the API filters # duplicate instance records, even if the user is listing servers at # this exact moment only one copy of the instance will be returned. self.instance.hidden = False # Update the instance mapping to point at the target cell. This is so # that the confirm/revert actions will be performed on the resized # instance in the target cell rather than the destroyed guest in the # source cell. Note that we could do this before finishing the resize # on the dest host, but it makes sense to defer this until the # instance is successfully resized in the dest host because if that # fails, we want to be able to rebuild in the source cell to recover # the instance. instance_mapping = objects.InstanceMapping.get_by_instance_uuid( self.context, self.instance.uuid) instance_mapping.cell_mapping = self.target_cell_mapping # If this fails the cascading task failures should delete the instance # in the target cell database so we do not need to hide it again. instance_mapping.save() # Mark the source cell instance record as hidden=True to hide it from # the user when listing servers. self.source_cell_instance.hidden = True self.source_cell_instance.save() def _execute(self): # Finish the resize on the destination host in the target cell. self._finish_snapshot_based_resize_at_dest() # Do the instance.hidden/instance_mapping.cell_mapping swap. self._update_instance_mapping() def rollback(self): # The method executed in this task are self-contained for rollbacks. pass :returns: A 2-item tuple of: - The active Migration object from the target cell DB - The CellMapping for the target cell return target_cell_migration, target_cell_mapping def _finish_resize_at_dest( self, target_cell_migration, target_cell_mapping): """Executes FinishResizeAtDestTask :param target_cell_migration: Migration object from the target cell DB :param target_cell_mapping: CellMapping object for the target cell """ task = FinishResizeAtDestTask( self._target_cell_context, self._target_cell_instance, target_cell_migration, self.instance, self.compute_rpcapi, target_cell_mapping) task.execute() self._completed_tasks['FinishResizeAtDestTask'] = task target_cell_migration, target_cell_mapping = ( self._setup_target_cell_db()) # Finish the resize at the destination host, swap the hidden fields # on the instances and update the instance mapping. self._finish_resize_at_dest(target_cell_migration, target_cell_mapping)
deleted_lines: :returns: The active Migration object from the target cell DB. return target_cell_migration target_cell_migration = self._setup_target_cell_db() # TODO(mriedem): Copy data to dest cell DB. # TODO(mriedem): Update instance mapping to dest cell DB. # TODO(mriedem): Spawn in target cell host: # - Use new flavor to spawn guest # - Wait for ACTIVE or keep powered off # - Activate target host port bindings # - Update/complete volume attachments and update BDM.attachment_id.

subject: Add finish_snapshot_based_resize_at_dest compute method
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-02-06 00:34:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9ce3879b12cb60e52e1eab185f54899e346c2f73', 'message': 'WIP: Add finish_snapshot_based_resize_at_dest compute method

This adds a new method to the nova-compute service which will
be synchronously RPC called from (super)conductor on the
destination host in the target cell during a cross-cell resize.

The method is similar to how the existing finish_resize method
works but parts are more like unshelve_instance, i.e. the use
of _prep_block_device, driver.spawn and deleting the snapshot
image (if there is one) after the guest is spawned.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: I46728c191997da3c7b4c6ed9d6d3f9e6fb73ca3f

commit_message:
Add finish_snapshot_based_resize_at_dest compute method

This adds a new method to the nova-compute service which will
be synchronously RPC called from (super)conductor on the
destination host in the target cell during a cross-cell resize.

The method is similar to how the existing finish_resize method
works but parts are more like unshelve_instance, i.e. the use
of _prep_block_device, driver.spawn and deleting the snapshot
image (if there is one) after the guest is spawned.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: I46728c191997da3c7b4c6ed9d6d3f9e6fb73ca3f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/80/635080/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * 5.4 - Add finish_snapshot_based_resize_at_dest() def finish_snapshot_based_resize_at_dest(self, ctxt, instance, migration): """Finishes the snapshot-based resize at the destination compute. Sets up block devices and networking on the destination compute and spawns the guest. Relies on the instance.migration_context for information about the snapshot image reference (if not a volume-backed server) and the new flavor. This is a synchronous RPC call using the ``long_rpc_timeout`` configuration option. :param ctxt: nova auth request context targeted at the target cell DB :param instance: The Instance object being resized with the ``migration_context`` field set. Upon successful completion of this method the vm_state should be "resized", the task_state should be None, and migration context and flavor-related fields should be set on the instance. :param migration: The Migration object for this resize operation. Upon successful completion of this method the migration status should be "finished". :raises: nova.exception.MigrationError if the destination compute service is too old for this method """ client = self.router.client(ctxt) version = '5.4' if not client.can_send_version(version): raise exception.MigrationError(reason=_('Compute too old')) cctxt = client.prepare( server=migration.dest_compute, version=version, call_monitor_timeout=CONF.rpc_response_timeout, timeout=CONF.long_rpc_timeout) return cctxt.call( ctxt, 'finish_snapshot_based_resize_at_dest', instance=instance, migration=migration)

subject: Avoid error 500 on shelve task_state race
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-11-02 00:16:18.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/shelve.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_shelve.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/8ee59604dcd9f770286f54e3a39c80f54413c358', 'message': 'Avoid error 500 on shelve task_state race

When shelving a server and saving its new SHELVING task state, we
expect the current task state to be None and do not handle any
UnexpectedTaskStateError exceptions that the database layer may throw
at us. In those cases, we return an error 500 to the user, when in
actuality an error 409 conflict would be more appropriate. This
patch makes the API layer handle UnexpectedTaskStateError exceptions
and return a 409 to the user.

NOTE(artom) Conflicts:
 * nova/api/openstack/compute/shelve.py because
   InstanceUnknownCell stopped being handled as of
   95dc5d0ab558604df7d8ef31eba8f9efaee9c474 in train
 * nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_shelve.py due to the
   vm_states import that was present in train as of
   27b6c18c666389ee68935f28cf340b7673879d6f but is missing from stein.

Closes-bug: 1850694
Change-Id: Ie0b421cd5d3a5781c1dd09fab4ed013ece0f939d
(cherry picked from commit a423d8b27785623550f401a200b68ca926c0a119)
(cherry picked from commit 32dbd2f585ef1902478170f3a1153b1f71e81db3)
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid error 500 on shelve task_state race

When shelving a server and saving its new SHELVING task state, we
expect the current task state to be None and do not handle any
UnexpectedTaskStateError exceptions that the database layer may throw
at us. In those cases, we return an error 500 to the user, when in
actuality an error 409 conflict would be more appropriate. This
patch makes the API layer handle UnexpectedTaskStateError exceptions
and return a 409 to the user.

NOTE(artom) Conflicts:
 * nova/api/openstack/compute/shelve.py because
   InstanceUnknownCell stopped being handled as of
   95dc5d0ab558604df7d8ef31eba8f9efaee9c474 in train
 * nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_shelve.py due to the
   vm_states import that was present in train as of
   27b6c18c666389ee68935f28cf340b7673879d6f but is missing from stein.

Closes-bug: 1850694
Change-Id: Ie0b421cd5d3a5781c1dd09fab4ed013ece0f939d
(cherry picked from commit a423d8b27785623550f401a200b68ca926c0a119)
(cherry picked from commit 32dbd2f585ef1902478170f3a1153b1f71e81db3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/30/692630/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import sixfrom nova.compute import task_states from nova.compute import vm_states @mock.patch('nova.objects.instance.Instance.save') def test_shelve_task_state_race(self, mock_save, get_instance_mock): instance = fake_instance.fake_instance_obj( self.req.environ['nova.context'], vm_state=vm_states.ACTIVE, task_state=None) instance.launched_at = instance.created_at get_instance_mock.return_value = instance mock_save.side_effect = exception.UnexpectedTaskStateError( instance_uuid=instance.uuid, expected=None, actual=task_states.SHELVING) ex = self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPConflict, self.controller._shelve, self.req, uuidsentinel.fake, body={'shelve': {}}) self.assertIn('Conflict updating instance', six.text_type(ex)) mock_save.assert_called_once_with(expected_task_state=[None]) @mock.patch('nova.api.openstack.common.get_instance')

commit_message:
SSL CS certs are multi-line values

When rendering the multi-line string in the identity.yaml
file, it is necessary to denote the multi-line string.

Change-Id: I6dca3e2445286423a785e1c0973fa7e1d43b6797
Closes-Bug: #1835490

commit_message:
Updated ansible uri module HEADERS_ field

This fixes a deprecation warning that gets displayed when running
the kibana/post_config 'Get kibana default indexes' task.

HEADERS_ has been deprecated since ansible 2.1 and will be
removed in 2.9.

https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/modules/uri_module.html

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I177113c606119505c6cb69c66a326f7cbdaf2196
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/45/657145/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update packages in virtualenvs

Kayobe uses a number of virtual environments on the remote hosts for
python dependencies such as shade, python-openstackclient, docker, etc.
By default these are stored in /opt/kayobe/venvs/. Typically we do not
provide version restrictions when installing these packages, so over the
course of time they may become stale and incompatible.

This change installs the latest version of packages allowed by OpenStack
upper constraints.

It also adds a new variable, 'pip_upper_constraints_file', to set the
upper constraints file. The existing variable
'kolla_upper_constraints_file' now defaults to the value of
'pip_upper_constraints_file'.

Conflicts:
	ansible/group_vars/all/kolla

Change-Id: I8d2956f95bbc44b5a9e88e7569372048a62f12f5
Story: 2005923
Task: 34193
(cherry picked from commit ddfd6b6202a2a97d7e0d3372624f959b922828b1)

subject: Use long_rpc_timeout in conductor migrate_server RPC API call
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-11-01 14:20:34.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conductor/rpcapi.py', 'nova/conf/rpc.py', 'nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/cd0021157b67e3aba40fb026ee4fb0e00233b237', 'message': "Use long_rpc_timeout in conductor migrate_server RPC API call

The conductor migrate_server RPC method is a blocking RPC call
used by both the API during a resize / cold migrate request and
by the compute service if rescheduling from a failed prep_resize
operation on the selected dest host (or alternate).

Currently the RPC call is using the global rpc_response_timeout
which defaults to 60 seconds. When coming from the API request,
we're going from API to conductor to scheduler and don't return
the response to the API caller until conductor casts to the
first selected destination host's prep_resize method. In a large
deployment, or under heavy load on the control plane, this could
take long enough to trip the rpc_response_timeout and result in
a MessagingTimeout 500 error response to the user.

Reschedules from the compute should be faster since they don't
involve a roundtrip call to the scheduler (since we have alternate
selections since Queens).

This makes the migrate_server method use the long_rpc_timeout
config for the overall timeout which defaults to 1800 seconds.
The rpc_response_timeout becomes the heartbeat value to make sure
the call is still alive.

This was noticed during at least one particularly slow resize
call that timed out in the gate [1].

Related-Bug: #1763070

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010494.html

Change-Id: I9115ef6df59844cd6e702f19ba38ffbf9f8b35d3
"}]
commit_message:
Use long_rpc_timeout in conductor migrate_server RPC API call

The conductor migrate_server RPC method is a blocking RPC call
used by both the API during a resize / cold migrate request and
by the compute service if rescheduling from a failed prep_resize
operation on the selected dest host (or alternate).

Currently the RPC call is using the global rpc_response_timeout
which defaults to 60 seconds. When coming from the API request,
we're going from API to conductor to scheduler and don't return
the response to the API caller until conductor casts to the
first selected destination host's prep_resize method. In a large
deployment, or under heavy load on the control plane, this could
take long enough to trip the rpc_response_timeout and result in
a MessagingTimeout 500 error response to the user.

Reschedules from the compute should be faster since they don't
involve a roundtrip call to the scheduler (since we have alternate
selections since Queens).

This makes the migrate_server method use the long_rpc_timeout
config for the overall timeout which defaults to 1800 seconds.
The rpc_response_timeout becomes the heartbeat value to make sure
the call is still alive.

This was noticed during at least one particularly slow resize
call that timed out in the gate [1].

Related-Bug: #1763070

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010494.html

Change-Id: I9115ef6df59844cd6e702f19ba38ffbf9f8b35d3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/50/692550/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix baremetal serial console autoenable

If ironic_serial_console_autoenable is set to true, ironic compute node
serial consoles are automatically enabled during kayobe overcloud post
configure. However, the baremetal-compute-serial-console.yml playbook
expects a variable called cmd to be defined, and set to 'enable' in
order to enable serial consoles. This patch fixes the issue.

We also add a conditional to only import the playbook when ironic is
enabled in the overcloud.

Change-Id: Ice26a113f9023b1a25a4af0552d07c5e95e64556
Story: 2006662
Task: 36924
(cherry picked from commit 5977a4411921c1880ee023b945ac2cceb533749a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/35/692335/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add debugging statements to wait for resources loop

When there is a timeout waiting for resources to become available,
it can be diffciult to determine why this happened. This should
aid in diagnosing the issue.

Change-Id: Id2cb5202a54c03b5e23316aa1d0874072e4e2efe

added_lines: _RETRY_LIMIT_FAILURE_TEMPLATE = ( "exceeded retry limit of {max_retries} whilst waiting for resources to " "become available. The expected set of resources was: {expected}, but" "on the last check we found: {discovered}" )def discover_resources(module, specifiers): :return: dictionary mapping specifier to total return actual discovered = {} discovered = discover_resources(module, specifiers) if meets_criteria(discovered, expected): max_retries=max_retries, expected=expected, discovered=discovered)
deleted_lines: _RETRY_LIMIT_FAILURE_TEMPLATE = "exceeded retry limit of {max_retries} " \ "whilst waiting for resources to become " \ "available"def are_resources_available(module, specifiers, expected): :param expected: dictionary of the form: {(resource_class, traits): amount } :return: True if resource available, otherwise False return meets_criteria(actual, expected) if are_resources_available(module, specifiers, expected): max_retries=max_retries)

commit_message:
Allow introspection some time to start in ironic-inspector

We expect introspection to start immediately after issuing "inspect"
action to ironic. In reality, it can take a few seconds, so wait
up to 90 seconds (by default).

Change-Id: If6c23e139d7d7bcadd416b6228c16a5fb4975c48
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-tempest-plugin refs/changes/24/689524/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Avoid failure if dhcp_end or dhcp_start isn't set

Since dhcp_start and dhcp_end aren't mandatory option, we have to ensure
the validation doesn't fail when they aren't present.

This change introduce a new "default" param to the "ini" module,
allowing to return a success (with the default value) even if the key
isn't found in the file.

commit_message:
Add 'path' query parameter to console access url

Starting in noVNC v1.1.0, the token query parameter is no longer
forwarded via cookie [1]. We must instead use the 'path' query
parameter to pass the token through to the websocketproxy [2].
This means that if someone deploys noVNC v1.1.0, VNC consoles will
break in nova because the code is relying on the cookie functionality
that v1.1.0 removed.

This modifies the ConsoleAuthToken.access_url property to include the
'path' query parameter as part of the returned access_url that the
client will use to call the console proxy service.

This change is backward compatible with noVNC < v1.1.0. The 'path' query
parameter is a long supported feature in noVNC.

Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1822676

  Conflicts:
      nova/tests/unit/console/test_websocketproxy.py

NOTE(lyarwood): The test conflicts with Queens are due to
If1b6e5f20d2ea82d94f5f0550f13189fc9bc16c4 not being present in Queens.

[1] https://github.com/novnc/noVNC/commit/51f9f0098d306bbc67cc8e02ae547921b6f6585c
[2] https://github.com/novnc/noVNC/pull/1220

Change-Id: I2ddf0f4d768b698e980594dd67206464a9cea37b
(cherry picked from commit 9606c80402f6db20d62b689c58aa8f024183628a)
(cherry picked from commit 186aff98b751b973dd5a7de9c8077b1a8bca0ba9)
(cherry picked from commit d72f24569ea9da1f045927471b8d27c41837bf4a)

commit_message:
Reduce scope of 'path' query parameter to noVNC consoles

This is a partial revert of commit
9606c80402f6db20d62b689c58aa8f024183628a which added the 'path' query
parameter to work with noVNC v1.1.0. This broke all other console types
using websockify server (serial, spice) because the websockify server
itself doesn't know how to handle the 'path' query parameter. It is the
noVNC vnc_lite.html file which parses the 'path' variable and uses it
as the url to the websockify server. So, all other console types should
*not* be generating a console access url with a 'path' query parameter,
only noVNC.

Closes-Bug: #1845243

NOTE(lyarwood): The test conflicts with Queens are due to
If1b6e5f20d2ea82d94f5f0550f13189fc9bc16c4 not being present in Queens.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/unit/console/test_websocketproxy.py
    nova/tests/unit/objects/test_console_auth_token.py

Change-Id: I9521f21a685edc44121d75bdf534c201fa87c2d7
(cherry picked from commit 54125a75fb056dbea115408610f90e7d6eee5139)
(cherry picked from commit e736babdfea277720634ac00fd9dc119042837b9)

commit_message:
Add section-placement

The placement config may be useful among more than one charm as
more services start to use the placement service. This patch adds
a single source of placement sectional config.

Change-Id: Id99e750f7b43dd0c893790eaa6fb79f7ce064f12
Related-Bug: 1850691
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-layer-openstack refs/changes/26/692426/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[Configuration] Switch to stestr.

According to OpenStack summit session, stestr is maintained project to
which all OpenStack projects should migrate.

Change-Id: Ib8f2da1750858e4a6a01b41975c7efc1ee14bc3d

commit_message:
Allow vendor_data to be included in a configdrive dict

configdrive can contain a vendor_data2.json file containing key/value
pairs injected by nova's vendordata mechanism[1].

This change lets Ironic accept a vendor_data key when configdrive is
provided as json, allowing parity with nova.

This change requires an openstacksdk release 0.37.0

[1] https://www.madebymikal.com/nova-vendordata-deployment-an-excessively-detailed-guide/

Change-Id: Id990b970619a113c5d5ead47fb550870d91b5e04
Task: 36756
Story: 2006597
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

commit_message:
Honor Debug for container image prepare

We were never using Debug if ContainerImagePrepareDebug was not set.
This change adds the Debug param and updates ContainerImagePrepareDebug
to be '' by default. This makes it honor the Debug setting if
ContainerImagePrepareDebug is not configured.

Change-Id: I09b3b112d7654fed5270c0b1148b57b91b4a3215
Related-Bug: #1850934
(cherry picked from commit f70ba4bfa467d5622dc4d781a4d3b108064de6ae)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/98/692598/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-10-07 12:52:36.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/kolla-openstack.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/commit/b05fc00dcf059ce961eb1355b359b443883cb17f', 'message': 'Fix validation of locally built IPA when ironic is disabled

In an environment where ironic is disabled, but IPA images are built
locally for the seed, the following task will fail in a number of
commands, e.g. kayobe overcloud service deploy:

We need to only execute this task when ironic is enabled.

Task: 36935
'}]
commit_message:
Fix validation of locally built IPA when ironic is disabled

In an environment where ironic is disabled, but IPA images are built
locally for the seed, the following task will fail in a number of
commands, e.g. kayobe overcloud service deploy:

Validate the presence of locally built Ironic Python Agent (IPA) images

We need to only execute this task when ironic is enabled.

Change-Id: I61067164a003bcdf6079cdaca36f0e1755186f60
Story: 2006669
Task: 36935
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/17/687017/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
DNM: Use python 3.6 in CentOS source images via IUS

We can use this as a way to test python 3 on CentOS prior to the
availability of CentOS 8.

Change-Id: Ie895f1edbfc914fd23889b6ea7da608d0718ccfd

commit_message:
WIP: Fedora support for python3 package testing

RDO is currently using a version of Fedora 28 to test the python3
packaging for the next version of CentOS/RHEL.  This change updates adds
basic support to support Fedora28 as a build option.

Change-Id: Ia6bb2c1de260e099cf44f47b190be032007ac8b1

commit_message:
Fix mysql_install_db failure

mysql_install_db will detect binary file path, when using
mysql_install_db install from distro, --rpm parameter is required

Change-Id: I64a648f72073a3e8bab802c31873112958296c90

commit_message:
Remove Zuul configuration

Pike is now end of life.

The goal here is to disable pike publishing jobs, and the CI would need
some work get it passing just to remove those jobs, so it's simpler to
remove it entirely.

Change-Id: I806b55302e0da4ebaeb5610ad2ae9bfe1138e79b

commit_message:
Allow nova to delete volume with cinder auth

If "reclaim_instance_interval" has been set in nova conf,
attched volume may not be delete while instacne deleted.
Adding cinder auth in nova conf can solve the problem.

Change-Id: I9eb3a74c2f6976043cc35a94915f1fcecb9ef601
Closes-Bug:  1850279
(cherry picked from commit 44a302d7d239bfbe1950e36df533e1ccedd4233d)

commit_message:
Allow nova to delete volume with cinder auth

If "reclaim_instance_interval" has been set in nova conf,
attched volume may not be delete while instacne deleted.
Adding cinder auth in nova conf can solve the problem.

Change-Id: I9eb3a74c2f6976043cc35a94915f1fcecb9ef601
Closes-Bug:  1850279
(cherry picked from commit 44a302d7d239bfbe1950e36df533e1ccedd4233d)

subject: Use mariabackup for database backups
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-10-23 14:53:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/8e75b6a477642df1479640ab7f610d3741c9297a', 'message': 'Use mariabackup for database backups

Currently, Xtrabackup is used for database backups. However, Xtrabackup is not
compatible with MariaDB 10.3. This change switches to use mariabackup, which is
available in the mariadb image.

Change-Id: Id52b9b1f7b013277e401b1f6b8aed34473d2b2c4
Closes-Bug: #1843043
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/690589
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-10-23 15:05:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/d0149b5db171ba0a705584193d381fdd1f3a495a', 'message': 'Use mariabackup for database backups

Currently, Xtrabackup is used for database backups. However, Xtrabackup
is not compatible with MariaDB 10.3. This change switches to use
mariabackup [1], which is available in the mariadb image.

The documented full and incremental restore procedures have been
modified to use mariabackup, following [2] and [3].

[1] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/mariabackup-overview/
[2] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/full-backup-and-restore-with-mariabackup/
[3] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/incremental-backup-and-restore-with-mariabackup/

Change-Id: Id52b9b1f7b013277e401b1f6b8aed34473d2b2c4
Closes-Bug: #1843043
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/690589
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2019-10-24 15:20:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/23ce1dd767f3c1cadf542cbbf1999219f4a44ec7', 'message': 'Use mariabackup for database backups

is not compatible with MariaDB 10.3. This change switches to use

commit_message:
Use mariabackup for database backups

Currently, Xtrabackup is used for database backups. However, Xtrabackup
is not compatible with MariaDB 10.3. This change switches to use
mariabackup [1], which is available in the mariadb image.

The documented full and incremental restore procedures have been
modified to use mariabackup, following [2] and [3].

[1] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/mariabackup-overview/
[2] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/full-backup-and-restore-with-mariabackup/
[3] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/incremental-backup-and-restore-with-mariabackup/

Change-Id: Id52b9b1f7b013277e401b1f6b8aed34473d2b2c4
Closes-Bug: #1843043
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/691290

commit_message:
Add xfsprogs to nova-compute

xfsprogs is required for formatting XFS ephemeral disk partitions
when format=xfs is specified as instance create failes with
'mkfs.xfs: No such file or directory' due to missing xfsprogs
package in the nova-compute container.

Closes-Bug: #1850610

Conflicts:
      docker/nova/nova-compute/Dockerfile.j2

Change-Id: Iaf3414464f3dd747427247339c6b201b352063cb
(cherry picked from commit 9b1a243a3a1669532f25bbdcbc56b78f0f72882c)
(cherry picked from commit 23e488dfe73a9273698f2a33d8b74f770d9a83f6)

subject: Avoid error 500 on shelve task_state race
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-11-01 23:50:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/shelve.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_shelve.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/32dbd2f585ef1902478170f3a1153b1f71e81db3', 'message': 'Avoid error 500 on shelve task_state race

When shelving a server and saving its new SHELVING task state, we
expect the current task state to be None and do not handle any
UnexpectedTaskStateError exceptions that the database layer may throw
at us. In those cases, we return an error 500 to the user, when in
actuality an error 409 conflict would be more appropriate. This
patch makes the API layer handle UnexpectedTaskStateError exceptions
and return a 409 to the user.

Closes-bug: 1850694
Change-Id: Ie0b421cd5d3a5781c1dd09fab4ed013ece0f939d
(cherry picked from commit a423d8b27785623550f401a200b68ca926c0a119)
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid error 500 on shelve task_state race

When shelving a server and saving its new SHELVING task state, we
expect the current task state to be None and do not handle any
UnexpectedTaskStateError exceptions that the database layer may throw
at us. In those cases, we return an error 500 to the user, when in
actuality an error 409 conflict would be more appropriate. This
patch makes the API layer handle UnexpectedTaskStateError exceptions
and return a 409 to the user.

Closes-bug: 1850694
Change-Id: Ie0b421cd5d3a5781c1dd09fab4ed013ece0f939d
(cherry picked from commit a423d8b27785623550f401a200b68ca926c0a119)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/28/692628/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.compute import task_states @mock.patch('nova.objects.instance.Instance.save') def test_shelve_task_state_race(self, mock_save, get_instance_mock): instance = fake_instance.fake_instance_obj( self.req.environ['nova.context'], vm_state=vm_states.ACTIVE, task_state=None) instance.launched_at = instance.created_at get_instance_mock.return_value = instance mock_save.side_effect = exception.UnexpectedTaskStateError( instance_uuid=instance.uuid, expected=None, actual=task_states.SHELVING) ex = self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPConflict, self.controller._shelve, self.req, uuidsentinel.fake, body={'shelve': {}}) self.assertIn('Conflict updating instance', six.text_type(ex)) mock_save.assert_called_once_with(expected_task_state=[None]) @mock.patch('nova.api.openstack.common.get_instance')

commit_message:
Add agents.l3 "radvd_user" configuration option

Based on new Neutron configuration option [1], it will allow to define
the user to run the radvd daemon in the L3 agent.

By default, the user will be "root", to solve the problem found in the
related bug.

[1] Ie9a6fbf04d453a3c1c0bddf9ecaa3d4d6467e8ff

Change-Id: I8a1bff166ee78dca402457fd1498e5906380c9ed
Closes-Bug: #1844688
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/46/691846/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*radvd_user*] # (optional) The username passed to radvd, used to drop root privileges and # change user ID to username and group ID to the primary group of username. # If no user specified, the user executing the L3 agent will be passed. If # "root" specified, because radvd is spawned as root, no "username" parameter # will be passed. # $radvd_user = 'root', 'DEFAULT/radvd_user': value => $radvd_user;

commit_message:
WIP: Add conf to not update to placement during instance_claim

This is an experiment to see if adding configuration to not
call _update_to_placement from instance_claim is worth doing.

This gets around issues present when every time an instance
is claimed, inventory changes, and thus _update_to_placement
needs to do work. Under high scheduling churn, this will lead
to generation conflicts and extra work.

There was a suggestion that this be done by checking for
virt driver type, since this problem presents itself with
the vmware virt driver, but doing do would mean the functionality
is not configurable and in some environments having the update
on instance_claim is important. In others it is better to let
the periodic job do it.

WIP because no explict test for the feature and presumably we
need at least a bug associated with this. Pushing it up early
so zuul can do its thing.

Change-Id: Iaa7235a4d95b1d3644dbf8d19b1df7791c7fad47

commit_message:
Workaround ironic inspector startup issue

If ironic inspector starts up before ironic-api is accessible, we see
the following error:

AttributeError: StrictVersion instance has no attribute 'version'

This actually prevents startup of ironic inspector.

Example: http://paste.openstack.org/show/756342/

The underlying issue is in python-ironicclient:
https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2006393.

The workaround employed here is to wait for ironic-api to become
available before starting ironic-inspector.

Change-Id: I674982eba5082fdc951cdcb8247d706278c64c1a
Closes-Bug: #1839866

commit_message:
Fix pbr for RDO

There is a python2-pbr package provided by the Fedora distro, so
the generated package conflicts with it. Fixing it by making
python-pbr provide and obsolete it.

Change-Id: I4705a27afd9f992ff71654c29f4ee349f8a0178b
(cherry picked from commit 70f10884932427ab34ec5b1d67cd8152299d2875)

subject: Set rootwrap daemon timeout for fullstack and functional tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-10-31 11:52:13.000000000', 'files': ['tools/deploy_rootwrap.sh', 'etc/rootwrap.conf'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/721887305038fe4449083eb6c33f355232c73555', 'message': 'Set rootwrap daemon timeout for fullstack and functional tests

Set a big timeout for rootwrap daemon in functional and fullstack
tests. The value defined in 7800, the same as the Zuul jobs
timeout.

This timeout increase will prevent the daemon to close when
executing a test root command, as described in the bug. An
unexpected rootwrap daemon closure is not considered as a normal
event during the test execution.

The default value set in the configuration file is 600 seconds, the
same as daemon default value. This timeout is increased only when
OS_SUDO_TESTING=1, that means functional and fullstack tests, when
using the script "tools/deploy_rootwrap.sh".

Change-Id: I691300a4e9a7cccd8887bc8f95ba9cea32988bac
Closes-Bug: #1850558
'}]
commit_message:
Set rootwrap daemon timeout for fullstack and functional tests

Set a big timeout for rootwrap daemon in functional and fullstack
tests. The value defined in 7800, the same as the Zuul jobs
timeout.

This timeout increase will prevent the daemon to close when
executing a test root command, as described in the bug. An
unexpected rootwrap daemon closure is not considered as a normal
event during the test execution.

The default value set in the configuration file is 600 seconds, the
same as daemon default value. This timeout is increased only when
OS_SUDO_TESTING=1, that means functional and fullstack tests, when
using the script "tools/deploy_rootwrap.sh".

Change-Id: I691300a4e9a7cccd8887bc8f95ba9cea32988bac
Closes-Bug: #1850558
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/47/692347/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Rootwrap daemon exits after this seconds of inactivity daemon_timeout=600

commit_message:
Avoid failure if dhcp_end or dhcp_start isn't set

Since dhcp_start and dhcp_end aren't mandatory option, we have to ensure
the validation doesn't fail when they aren't present.

This change introduce a new "default" param to the "ini" module,
allowing to return a success (with the default value) even if the key
isn't found in the file.

Change-Id: Ibd1e54b2d2748b3bf8d2c1cabad3a9faf832e9b2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations refs/changes/00/692300/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: default: "192.0.2.5" default: "192.0.2.24" start: "{{ dhcp_start.value }}" end: "{{ dhcp_end.value }}"
deleted_lines: start: "{{ dhcp_start.value|default('192.0.2.5', true) }}" end: "{{ dhcp_end.value|default('192.0.2.24', true) }}"

commit_message:
Update cirros image URL to use HTTPS.

The launch_workload test downloads a cirros image to
deploy a small set of instances in the overcloud.
However, the URL being used up to now is not available
any more as it's required to use secure HTTP. This
patch needs to be cherry-picked into all the releases
or it won't be possible to launch the check.

Change-Id: I676225dcfd18ac8423fb802d93bddffdeb29ef5f
(cherry picked from commit d1812f2a18e6b013d94d282b65f5a46e85bb7ff5)

commit_message:
Allow nova to delete volume with cinder auth

If "reclaim_instance_interval" has been set in nova conf,
attched volume may not be delete while instacne deleted.
Adding cinder auth in nova conf can solve the problem.

Change-Id: I9eb3a74c2f6976043cc35a94915f1fcecb9ef601
Closes-Bug:  1850279

commit_message:
Add a spec for K8s Metal3 baremetal operator

Moved from Train to Ussuri

Co-authored-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Doug Hellmann <doughellmann.com>

Change-Id: I4b58ff7bfaebd349e6eb7c43b8e2f268357c8b4e
Related-blueprint: undercloud-metal3-k8s
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-specs refs/changes/88/659288/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================================= Support provisioning via Kubernetes Metal3 baremetal operator ============================================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tripleo/+spec/undercloud-metal3-k8s We want to do a first baby step on the way of `Kubernetes operators framework<https://kubernetes.io/blog/2019/02/28/automate-operations-on-your-cluster-with-operatorhub.io/>`_ adoption. That is events-driven a deployment/management engine with a declarative API and programmable behavior. Operators allow to restore the declarative interface that we originally imagined in TripleO. Problem Description =================== There is a Distributed Compute Node (DCN) case for Edge computing that gets a lot of traction for OpenStack and targets real use cases for 5G mobile networks and Multi-Access Edge Computing environments. The case is also known as `Centralized Control Plane <https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Edge_Computing_Group/Edge_Reference_Architectures#Centralized_Control_Plane_Scenario>`_ scenario. Today it needs major improvements for managing large scale infrustracture(s) centrally yet distributed over WANs and the dependent features, such as IPv6 L3+ routed and secure hardware provisioning of nodes at the edge sites. Challenges arise from the current TripleO undercloud architecture that involves a lot of the moving parts not fitting the large scale requirements well, from the deployment framework itself, as well as from OpenStack projects, specifically Ironic. The main problem is that addressing such challenges in different ways for different Edge-oriented Infrastructure Management Platforms, like OpenStack, StarlingX, Akraino, or Kubernetes/OpenShift, is highly expensive in time, engineering and development resources. And it is also inefficient because upstream solutions require further adoption and vendoring for different deployment/management tooling of involved private/hybrid cloud offerings. Proposed Change =============== We aim for solving the aforementioned challenges via adoption of the Kubernetes operators framework. Although this spec is limited to only hardware provisioning components running on the undercloud, the scope of future changes may be widened as well. This proposal is about making the first steps into that direction "the right way". `Metal3 for Kubernetes <https://thenewstack.io/metal3-uses-openstacks-ironic-for-declarative-bare-metal-kubernetes>`_ and `Metal3 baremetal operator <https://github.com/metal3-io/baremetal-operator>`_ look forward for the better architecture choices for TripleO to become capable of managing thousands of nodes distributed over hundreds of edge sites. That architecture targets primarily edge environments stretched over WANs, secure and just future looking, thinking of growing Kubernetes adoption. It is also important to note that the declarative API and events-driven nature of Kubernetes operators also provide better hardware management (for this spec scope) capabilities for Day2 operations, like scaling out, firmware upgrades, isolating/fencing (forced power off) of untrusted nodes, and other reactive/situation-based scenarios. This is something that TripleO misses for the Edge story, but not limited to that. Overview -------- We do not want fully rearchitect the undercloud, but only to add enough K8s to run Metal3 on the undercloud for baremetal provisioning. Given that TripleO already aims to drive Ironic directly w/o Heat->Nova->Ironic overhead, we'll need somewhere to manage the state. Since Metal3 already handles this, it would be better to reuse it rather than write a whole new thing that's TripleO-specific. The long-term plan is to work with other communities, like Kubernetes/OpenShift, StarlingX and Akraino, to build a single set of operators. Then do the integration work to make sure that they can be used with the crucial (for Edge computing cases) features in parity. That works for the given spec scope but also may be the next steps after addressing the undercloud needs for supporting Edge DCN. For existing deployments, the upgrade path should be also available ideally, unless the operators framework implemented as an opt-in, for example limited to the Edge (DCN) cases only and providing no upgrade path for such cases. There is a lightweight `k3s <https://k3s.io/>`_ distribution that hopefully may be used for hosting the Metal3 operator on the undercloud. Kubernetes or OpenShift deployment should only be used, if any issues with the Metal3 operator running on k3s. The proposed Metal3 deployment should be implemented as an opt-in and disabled by default. It is recommended to only enable it for Edge DCN deployments. Alternatives ------------ Since Metal3 relies on k8s CRDs to store its state, this would require that the undercloud have a k8s installation, although it's worth noting that it does not require that the undercloud *is* a k8s installation. So the alternative could be exactly to require that undercloud *is* a k8s installation. It is also questionable which type of a Metal3 operator to use, either it should be Ansible or Golang based. The former may be not fitting well the complex behavior patterns for reacting on events. Also just running playbooks does not really needs an operator to benefit it. The final call should be made as a collaborative decision by the results of analyzing baremetal provisioning behavorial requirements and discussions with the other involved teams and communities, inlcuding but not limited to the TripleO Edge Squad, OpenShift teams, k8s-sig-cluster-lifecycle, Cluster Management APIs and the operators framework developers. Another alternative is solving all the outlined hardware management challenges for large scale and Edge specifics for Ironic and TripleO on its own and limiting it to the existing TripleO and OpenStack architecture. Security Impact --------------- When the opted-in Metal3 operator enabled, the undercloud will be taking additional security attack vectors and surface for the vulnerabilities associated with Kubernetes and the operators framework. The minion nodes, if running that optional functionality, would also need to have access to the the main undercloud's Kubernetes APIs. Upgrade Impact -------------- There is no upgrades possible for the Ironic services on undercloud into the Metal3 baremetal operator deployment. By default, Ironic will be used and there would be no upgrade impact as well. Overcloud deployments expect no upgrade impact for this spec scope. Other End User Impact --------------------- If implemented, there going to be a K8s cluster management UI to replace the deprecated TripleO UI. This should simplify the central management of the Edge sites' hardware. Performance Impact ------------------ * Removing the Heat->Nova->Ironic chain should drastically improve the provisioning times, performance and scale. Empowered by the undercloud minions feature, that should allow to go far beyond of the current scale limitations of a ~300 overcloud nodes. * Placing the deployed Metal3 replicas on undercloud minions, closer to the nodes being managed wit it at the edge, can improve performance by being closer to the end systems (less latency, etc). * Behavioral reactions/events based approach, which is native for K8s operators, should improve the overall performance of maintanance/Day2 management tasks, including those being performed centrally over the edge sites. Other Deployer Impact --------------------- Additional undercloud Metal3 K8s (and optionally, undercloud minion) roles and undercloud/minion config settings will be created. Additionally new environment files will be added to disable Ironic and allow the Metal3 deployments for undercloud/minions. When enabled, a minimalistic Kubernetes environment, with an optional K8s UI deployment will be added to the undercloud to host the Metal3 operators on undercloud/minions and providing a global view into the hardware nodes' state. It may be also technically possible to enable ML2/OVN backend for Neutron on the undercloud, when deploying with Metal3 instead of Ironic. Developer Impact ---------------- Metal3 and its K8s operator should be maintained by the original sources and kept TripleO compatible as of Train, as a collaborative effort with the aforementioned teams and communities. The existing Heat->Nova->Ironic chain could be deprecated for Train and abandoned later. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: bogdando Other contributors: slagle dtantsur EmilienM Work Items ---------- python-tripleoclient ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ * New configuration option in 'undercloud.conf' to disable Ironic on the undercloud and deploy Metal3 with the minimal required Kubernetes layout. No undercloud upgrades should be possible with that option enabled. * (Optional) new configuration option for 'undercloud-minion.conf' to drive the installation of the Metal3 operator over minions, no upgrades possible. tripleo-heat-templates ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ * New 'UndercloudMetal3K8s' role file that also covers the deployment of the required Kubernetes/k3s components as those have yet any use aside of that subject and may be considered as a single role. * (Optional) new 'UndercloudMinionMetal3K8s' role file for preparing over other undercloud minions for acting as a minimalistic k8s worker nodes and scaling the Metal3 over there. * New environment files for the undercloud/minions Metal3 deployment via operators framework and its K8s requirements. * Additional environment files to enable or disable Ironic components. UI -- (Optional) Tripleo UI is deprecated, so we should consider an option of adding some Kubernetes UI on undercloud to provide a global view into the state of hardware nodes used for deployed overcloud(s), including the central and edge sites. This may be implemented via an additional tripleo-heat-templates role and environment file, and controlled via an option in 'undercloud.conf' as well. Dependencies ============ Optional dependency is the undercloud minions to scale the Metal3 deployment over the K8s minions colocated with the undercloud minions. Mandatory dependencies is Metal3 itself and its baremetal operator, plus the minimal set of Kubernetes/OpenShift/k3s components to provide its functioning for undercloud/minions. Those should not be repackaged for TripleO/RDO but consumed from its original build sources. Testing ======= We would add a new CI job to test the provisioning of hardware with Metal3 and the required Kubernetes/OpenShift/k3s components deployed on the undercloud and optionally, an additional single minion worker undercloud node. This job will likely require no e2e testing for the overcloud and may omit deploying the latter. Documentation Impact ==================== We will need to document the installation and usage of the Metal3 operator as an opt-in, scaling it over undercloud minions. And the specific, like Edge DCN, use cases where this can be beneficial. References ========== See the notes from the Train PTG around Scaling. * https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/tripleo-ptg-train * https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/DEN-tripleo-forum-scale See the Undercloud Minions blueprint. * https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tripleo/+spec/undercloud-minion See k8s-sig-cluster-lifecycle and Cluster Management API work. * https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/cluster-api

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I19a6e10c3d0803cfc11b81e2141f2b3083315fe1

commit_message:
Adjust base_centos_yum_repo_packages for stable/train

Kolla upstream is adding centos-release-openstack-train release rpm in
master and stable/train branch after [1]. In tripleo builds this means it's configuring
both RDO Trunk master (delorean) repos and CloudSIG train repo. Mixing
both sets of repos can lead to undesired results so I'm removing
centos-release-openstack-train repo from config and letting
tripleo-repos configure as needed.

Also, I'm removing leftovers from old Ceph releases configuration.
Currently kolla is installing centos-release-ceph-nautilus so, tripleo
does not need to overrides it.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/689706

Change-Id: Ia551a7d2351bb91cc45e9c2d12f4afb4f6368bb7
(cherry picked from commit 3feedacdb741ee93ab02241344f1359e9d36230f)

commit_message:
Add xfsprogs to nova-compute

xfsprogs is required for formatting XFS ephemeral disk partitions
when format=xfs is specified as instance create failes with
'mkfs.xfs: No such file or directory' due to missing xfsprogs
package in the nova-compute container.

Closes-Bug: #1850610

Change-Id: Iaf3414464f3dd747427247339c6b201b352063cb
(cherry picked from commit 9b1a243a3a1669532f25bbdcbc56b78f0f72882c)

added_lines: it 'should use auth_endpoint when nothing else is available' do klass.expects(:auth_endpoint).returns(mock)
deleted_lines: describe '#get_public_endpoint' do it 'should return nothing if there is no keystone config file' do expect(klass.get_public_endpoint).to be_nil end it 'should return nothing if the keystone config file does not have a DEFAULT section' do mock = {} File.expects(:exists?).with("/etc/keystone/keystone.conf").returns(true) Puppet::Util::IniConfig::File.expects(:new).returns(mock) mock.expects(:read).with('/etc/keystone/keystone.conf') expect(klass.get_public_endpoint).to be_nil end it 'should fail if the keystone config file does not contain public endpoint' do mock = {'DEFAULT' => {}} File.expects(:exists?).with("/etc/keystone/keystone.conf").returns(true) Puppet::Util::IniConfig::File.expects(:new).returns(mock) mock.expects(:read).with('/etc/keystone/keystone.conf') expect(klass.get_public_endpoint).to be_nil end it 'should use the public_endpoint from keystone config file with no trailing slash' do mock = {'DEFAULT' => {'public_endpoint' => 'https://keystone.example.com/'}} File.expects(:exists?).with("/etc/keystone/keystone.conf").returns(true) Puppet::Util::IniConfig::File.expects(:new).returns(mock) mock.expects(:read).with('/etc/keystone/keystone.conf') expect(klass.get_public_endpoint).to eq('https://keystone.example.com') end end it 'should use public_endpoint when nothing else is available' do klass.expects(:public_endpoint).returns(mock) describe '#get_service_url when retrieving the security token' do it 'should return nothing when OS_ENDPOINT is not defined in environment' do ENV.clear expect(klass.get_service_url).to be_nil end it 'should return the OS_ENDPOINT from the environment' do ENV['OS_ENDPOINT'] = 'http://127.0.0.1:5001/v3' expect(klass.get_service_url).to eq('http://127.0.0.1:5001/v3') end it 'should use public_endpoint with the API version number' do ENV.clear mock = 'http://127.0.0.1:5001' klass.expects(:public_endpoint).twice.returns(mock) expect(klass.get_service_url).to eq('http://127.0.0.1:5001/v3') end end describe 'when retrieving the security token' do it 'should return nothing if there is no keystone config file' do File.expects(:exists?).with("/etc/keystone/keystone.conf").returns(false) expect(klass.get_admin_token).to be_nil end it 'should return nothing if the keystone config file does not have a DEFAULT section' do mock = {} File.expects(:exists?).with("/etc/keystone/keystone.conf").returns(true) Puppet::Util::IniConfig::File.expects(:new).returns(mock) mock.expects(:read).with('/etc/keystone/keystone.conf') expect(klass.get_admin_token).to be_nil end it 'should fail if the keystone config file does not contain an admin token' do mock = {'DEFAULT' => {'not_a_token' => 'foo'}} File.expects(:exists?).with("/etc/keystone/keystone.conf").returns(true) Puppet::Util::IniConfig::File.expects(:new).returns(mock) mock.expects(:read).with('/etc/keystone/keystone.conf') expect(klass.get_admin_token).to be_nil end it 'should parse the admin token if it is in the config file' do mock = {'DEFAULT' => {'admin_token' => 'foo'}} File.expects(:exists?).with("/etc/keystone/keystone.conf").returns(true) Puppet::Util::IniConfig::File.expects(:new).returns(mock) mock.expects(:read).with('/etc/keystone/keystone.conf') expect(klass.get_admin_token).to eq('foo') end end

commit_message:
CI: Pin Ansible to 2.8.x on Ubuntu during upgrades

Stein-only

Ansible 2.9 removed version_compare which Rocky relied on.

See https://review.opendev.org/692575 for change in Rocky.

Change-Id: I393d90396730bdfafe66ff473528bd30dfe63c21
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/55/692755/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # When upgrading from Rocky and earlier, we have to limit the version # due to version_compare being gone from Ansible 2.9 # see https://review.opendev.org/692575 for change in Rocky if [[ $ACTION =~ "upgrade" ]]; then ANSIBLE_VERSION="$ANSIBLE_VERSION,<2.9" fi

commit_message:
Add xfsprogs to nova-compute

xfsprogs is required for formatting XFS ephemeral disk partitions
when format=xfs is specified as instance create failes with
'mkfs.xfs: No such file or directory' due to missing xfsprogs
package in the nova-compute container.

Closes-Bug: #1850610

Conflicts:

commit_message:
Fix CI failures (ODL and searchlight)

Rocky only

searchlight: use the 6.0.0 Stein release

Searchlight did not release during Rocky cycle. So we left using
'master' tarball. Now Python 2.7 support got removed in Ussuri and our
CI builds fail. Pin to the 6.0.0 release from the Stein cycle.

Change ODL repo to nexus.opendaylight.org

(cherry picked from commit 939a56035b8f15b74dff2d68154963735b0f73b4)
(cherry picked from commit 5a08221cc4270dec3af5ff613731cc7be7576124)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/692575
Change-Id: Ib290fb2ec80f408c9d1e134595a5bb7ace922952
